triples.name: Bacterial growth
triples.relevance: The paper reviews how trade-offs mechanistically control bacterial growth rates and fitness strategies in microbes.

triples.name: Oligotroph
triples.relevance: The paper discusses slow-growing oligotrophic microbes widely distributed in ecosystems and their ecological implications.

triples.name: Evolutionary tradeoff
triples.relevance: The paper reviews the mechanistic role of trade-offs between growth and other traits like adaptability and survival in shaping bacterial phenotypes.

triples.name: Bet hedging (biology)
triples.relevance: The paper discusses bet-hedging strategies as a mechanism for microbes to improve fitness in fluctuating environments.

triples.name: Coexistence theory
triples.relevance: The paper highlights coexistence as an important ecological phenomenon emerging from trade-offs between microbial traits.

triples.name: Population heterogeneity
triples.relevance: The paper discusses population heterogeneity as a key ecological phenomenon resulting from trade-offs in microbial phenotypes.

triples.name: Copiotroph
triples.relevance: The paper examines copiotrophic lifestyles as an ecological strategy that emerges from growth rate and nutrient utilization trade-offs.
